0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• before administration, screen patients to identify those with acute kidney injury or chronic, severe kidney disease (GFR less than 30 mL/min/1.73 m(2)) since they are at high risk for nephrogenic systemic fibrosis; avoid use in patients with suspected or known impaired drug elimination unless alternative imaging modalities, including non-contrast MRI, are unable to provide essential diagnostic information; do not exceed the recommended dose; do not repeat the administration of the contrast agent during a single imaging session
  • initiate hemodialysis promptly for hemodialysis patients following administration of gadobenate dimeglumine to increase elimination.
  • Magnetic resonance angiography, Evaluation of known or suspected renal or aorto-ilio-femoral vascular disease: 0.1 mmol/kg (0.2 mL/kg) IV administered as a rapid bolus
  • Magnetic resonance imaging, CNS imaging: 0.1 mmol/kg (0.2 mL/kg) IV administered as a rapid bolus

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• before administration, screen patients to identify those with acute kidney injury or chronic, severe kidney disease (GFR less than 30 mL/min/1.73 m(2)) since they are at high risk for nephrogenic systemic fibrosis; avoid use in patients with suspected or known impaired drug elimination unless alternative imaging modalities, including non-contrast MRI, are unable to provide essential diagnostic information; do not exceed the recommended dose; do not repeat the administration of the contrast agent during a single imaging session
  • initiate hemodialysis promptly for hemodialysis patients following administration of gadobenate dimeglumine to increase elimination
  • safety and efficacy have not been established in pediatric patients less than 2 years of age
  • Magnetic resonance imaging, CNS imaging: (over 2 years of age) 0.1 mmol/kg (0.2 mL/kg) IV administered as a rapid bolus

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Magnetic resonance angiography, Evaluation of known or suspected renal or aorto-ilio-femoral vascular disease
  • Magnetic resonance imaging, CNS imaging
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
  • Carcinoma of breast; Diagnosis
  • Malignant neoplasm of liver; Diagnosis

2.title: Black Box Warning
2.mono:
Intravenous (Solution)
Gadolinium-based contrast agents increase the risk for nephrogenic systemic fibrosis (NSF) in patients with impaired elimination of the drugs (ie, chronic, severe renal insufficiency (GFR less than 30 mL/min/1.73 m(2)), or acute kidney injury. Avoid use of GBCAs unless the diagnostic information is essential and not available with non-contrast enhanced MRI. NSF may result in fatal or debilitating systemic fibrosis affecting the skin, muscle, and internal organs. Screen all patients for acute kidney injury and other conditions that may reduce renal function. For patients at risk for chronically reduced renal function (eg, age greater than 60 years, hypertension, or diabetes), perform lab testing to estimate the GFR. For patients with the highest NSF risk, do not exceed recommended dose and allow a sufficient time period for elimination prior to readministration.

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: allergic or hypersensitivity reaction to gadolinium-based contrasting agents

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• diabetes; risk of chronically reduced kidney function and development of fatal or debilitating nephrogenic system fibrosis; monitoring recommended
  • elderly patients (greater than 60 years of age); risk of chronically reduced kidney function and development of fatal or debilitating nephrogenic system fibrosis; monitoring recommended
  • hypertension, chronic; risk of chronically reduced kidney function and development of fatal or debilitating nephrogenic system fibrosis; monitoring recommended
  • impaired drug elimination, known or suspected; increased risk of fatal or debilitating nephrogenic systemic fibrosis; avoid use unless diagnostic information is essential and alternative imaging not available
  • kidney injury, acute; high risk for fatal or debilitating nephrogenic systemic fibrosis; do not exceed dose and allow sufficient time for elimination before re-administering
  • nephrogenic systemic fibrosis which can be fatal or debilitating may occur in patients with kidney dysfunction; monitoring recommended
  • renal insufficiency, chronic and severe (GFR less than 30 mL/min/1.73 m(2)); high risk for fatal or debilitating nephrogenic systemic fibrosis; do not exceed dose and allow sufficient time for elimination before re-administering
  • repeated or higher than recommended doses of gadolinium-based contrast agents; increased risk of fatal or debilitating nephrogenic systemic fibrosis; monitoring recommended
  • arrhythmias have been reported
  • asthma, allergy, or other hypersensitivity disorders; increased risk of hypersensitivity reactions; monitoring recommended
  • extravasation of gadobenate dimeglumine may lead to injection site reactions including pain, burning, swelling, blistering and necrosis; use caution to avoid local extravasation during IV administration
  • hemodialysis patients; prompt hemodialysis immediately following administration may be considered in order to enhance elimination
  • hypersensitivity reactions, including anaphylactic reactions and fatalities; have been reported; discontinue use immediately and institute appropriate therapy if hypersensitivity occurs
  • interference with visualization of certain lesions has occurred; use caution when interpreting contrast MRI images in the absence of companion non-contrast MRI images
  • renal insufficiency; acute renal failure requiring dialysis or worsening renal function has occurred with gadolinium-based contrast agents; risk increases with increasing dose; monitoring recommended
  • report suspected adverse reactions, including nephrogenic systemic fibrosis to the US Food and Drug Administration at 1-800-FDA-1088 or www.fda.gov/medwatch

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Gastrointestinal:Nausea (1.3%), Vomiting (adults, less than 0.5%; pediatric, 1.4%)
  • Neurologic:Headache (1.2%)
  • Other:Fever (0.9%)
Serious
  • Cardiovascular:Cardiac dysrhythmia, Chest pain (less than 0.5%), First degree atrioventricular block (less than 0.5%)
  • Dermatologic:Nephrogenic systemic fibrosis
  • Gastrointestinal:Necrotizing pancreatitis, acute (0.1%), Vomiting, Worsening (0.5%)
  • Immunologic:Anaphylaxis (0.1%)
  • Renal:Injury of kidney, Acute
  • Respiratory:Dyspnea (less than 0.5%), Pulmonary edema (0.1%)
  • Other:Angioedema

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Gadobenate dimeglumine, a paramagnetic agent, produces a large magnetic moment which results in a large local magnetic field. This increases the signal intensity (brightness) of tissue because relaxation rates of water molecules in the vicinity are enhanced.

1.title: Distribution
1.mono:
• Vd: 0.074 L/kg +/- 0.017 L/kg to 0.158 L/kg +/- 0.038 L/kg
  • Protein binding: not appreciable

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Intravenous
  • administer immediately after opening; discard unused product
  • administer as a rapid bolus IV injection; follow with saline flush of at least 5 mL for CNS imaging and at least 20 mL for imaging of renal or aorto-ilio-femoral vascular occlusive disease
  • imaging of CNS should begin immediately after administration
  • imaging of renal and aorto-ilio-femoral vessels should begin immediately after administration with scan delay calculated by test bolus or automatic bolus detection technique

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• enhanced visualization of MRI and MRA imaging indicates efficacy
  • laboratory tests or signs/symptoms of acute kidney injury and other conditions that may reduce renal function
  • estimated GFR for patients at risk for chronically reduced renal function
  • patient history and/or laboratory tests to screen for renal dysfunction
  • followup assessment of renal function in patients with a history of renal dysfunction
  • signs and symptoms of a hypersensitivity reaction during and for up to 2 hours after drug administration

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• This drug may cause headache or nausea.
  • Instruct patient to report signs/symptoms of nephrogenic systemic fibrosis (burning, itching, swelling, scaling, hardening and tightening of the skin; red or dark patches on the skin; muscle weakness; pain in hips or ribs; and joint stiffness).
